europeana:record.dc:title: Acarological and arachnological notes
Zoologische Mededelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Hammen, van der L.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Arthropoda

Actinotrichida; Anactinotrichida; Chelicerata; classification; fast running; gnathosoma; legs; life-cycle; locomotion; morphology; neostasoid; neostasoidy; postembryonic development; relationships; stasoid; stasoidy
europeana:record.dc:description: A study is made of four subjects in the fields of chelicerate morphology, postembryonic development and relationships, viz., the functional morphology of the legs in Anystis (a fastrunning Actinotrichid mite), the musculature of the gnathosoma of Glyptholaspis confusa (Fo√†) (an Anactinotrichid mite), the evolution of the chelicerate life-cycle in the case of an irregular number of instars, and the relationships of the chelicerate classes and subclasses.
